content.rendered:
We built Piklist from the ground up with security as our top priority. While we’ve taken every effort to consider security and privacy concerns while building this framework, we are aware that all software has bugs. Security in open source projects is a community effort, and we are now inviting the community to help.

Today, we are excited to announce the Piklist security bug bounty program on HackerOne. We are committed to working with the community to respond quickly to reported security issues and correct them. We will pay a reward for any legitimate security vulnerability reported responsibly through the program.

If you’re interested in getting paid to find security bugs, the Piklist HackerOne page has the details on our program.
